results.t: OUSTED | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: to force someone to leave a position of power, job, place, or competition: The president was ousted (from power) in a military coup in January 1987.
The meaning of OUST is to remove from or dispossess of property or position by legal action, by force, or by the compulsion of necessity. How to use oust in ...
adjective · expelled or removed: The recently ousted CEO has told the board of directors that he won't accept his $800,000 severance. · Law. ejected or evicted:.

results.t: OUST | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: to force someone to leave a position of power, job, place, or competition: The president was ousted (from power) in a military coup in January 1987.
1. to cause or force (someone or something) to leave a position of power, a competition, etc. The rebels ousted the dictator from power.
To oust is to “expel,” “kick out,” or “remove and replace.” When you oust someone, you are “giving them the boot.”

results.t: OUST definition and meaning | Collins English Dictionary
results.p: 2 meanings: 1. to force out of a position or place; supplant or expel 2. property law to deprive (a person) of the possession.
verb (used with object). to expel or remove from a place or position occupied: The bouncer ousted the drunk;. to oust the prime minister in the next election.

results.t: oust verb - Definition, pictures, pronunciation and usage ...
results.p: ​to force somebody out of a job or position of power, especially in order to take their place. oust somebody (as something) He was ousted as chairman.
